what: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
title: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
text: Given renewal rates different isotopic probes time normal distributions isotopic values time, resulting normal distributions isotopic probes calculated.

title: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
code: computeResult(data, timeVars, boneVars = NULL, meanVar, sdVar, cor = 0.5)

title: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
text: data dataframe specifying renewal rates different probes time interval. renewal rates 0 100 (percentages). dataframe include column specifying time-index (e.g. 1, 2, 3, ...) well columns different bones. Furthermore, dataframe contain mean sd values time interval. timeVars character string specifying name column indicating time. boneVars vector character strings indicating relevant variables containing renewal rates bones teeth. meanVar character string specifying name column indicating mean values isotopic probes time. sdVar character string specifying name column indicating standard deviation isotopic probes time. cor temporal correlation neighbouring time points. Defaults 0.5

title: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
text: data.frame containing resulting mean standard deviation bone/tooth well covariances.

title: Function to compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones — computeResult
code: testDat <- data.frame(   t = 1:3,   bone = c(100, 50, 0),   mean = c(1, 3, 50),   sd = c(1, 3, 50) )   computeResult(   data = testDat,   timeVars = "t",   boneVars = "bone",   meanVar = "mean",   sdVar = "sd" ) #>          mean      sd #> bone 1.999994 1.80277

what: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
title: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
text: Given renewal rates different isotopic probes time, model estimates normal distribution isotopic values time interval. given rates renewal, first influence time interval final isotopic value calculated. proportion used regressor fully Bayesian linear model. variance estimated rbf-Kernel-Matrix, hyperparameters chosen correlation time intervals close 0.5. estimation implemented using link[rstan]{rstan}.

title: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
code: estimateIntervals(   renewalRates,   timeVars,   boneVars = NULL,   indVar = "",   isoMean,   isoSigma,   renewalRatesSD = NULL,   mu_df = 3,   mu_mean = 0,   mu_sd = 20,   rho_mean = 1,   rho_sd = 0.25,   alpha_mean = 2,   alpha_sd = 0.5,   mc = TRUE,   adapt_delta = 0.98,   max_treedepth = 15,   chains = 4,   iter = 2000,   burnin = 500,   ... )

title: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
text: renewalRates dataframe specifying renewal rates different probes time interval. renewalRates 0 100 (percentages). dataframe include column specifying time-index (e.g. 1, 2, 3, ...) well columns different bones. renewal rates contain times origin, containing 100. timeVars character string specifying name column indicating time. boneVars vector character strings indicating relevant variables containing renewal rates bones teeth. given, variables bones variables dataframe apart time variables. indVar character string specifying name column indicating individual. isoMean numeric number indicating mean isotopic values measured. isoSigma numeric, positive number indicating standard deviation isotopic values measured. renewalRatesSD optional dataframe specifying renewal rates uncertainties standard deviations different probes time interval. mu_df Hyperparameter mean interval estimates: degrees freedom non-standardized t-Student distribution. Defaults 1. mu_mean Hyperparameter mean interval estimates: mean non-standardized t-Student distribution. Defaults 0. mu_sd Hyperparameter mean interval estimates: standard deviation non-standardized t-Student distribution. Defaults 10. rho_mean Hyperparameter length scale rbf-kernel: mean normal. Defaults 1. rho_sd Hyperparameter length scale rbf-kernel: standard deviation normal. Defaults 0.25. alpha_mean Hyperparameter signal variance rbf-kernel: mean normal. Defaults 2. alpha_sd Hyperparameter signal variance rbf-kernel: standard deviation normal. Defaults 0.5. mc boolean indicating multiple cores used. TRUE, default, 4 cores used. adapt_delta numeric value 0 1 controlling samplers behavior. Defaults 0.9999. See stan details. max_treedepth numeric, positive value controling NUTS sampler. Defaults 25. See stan details. chains Number chains mcmc. Defaults 4 iter Number iterations per chain mcmc. Defaults 2000 burnin Number burnin iterations per chain mcmc. Defaults 500 ... Arguments passed rstand sampling

title: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
text: fitted object class TemporalIso.

title: Function to estimate temporal changes in isotopic values — estimateIntervals
code: if (FALSE) { #dataset with renewal rates data <- data.frame(  intStart = 0:5,  intEnd = 1:6,  bone1 = c(100, 50, 20, 10, 5, 2),  bone2 = c(100, 10, 5, 1, 1, 1),  tooth1 = c(0, 100, 0, 0, 0, 0),  tooth2 = c(0, 0, 100, 0, 0, 0) ) # isotope-values and sd y_mean <- c(-10, -7, -12, -9) y_sigma <- c(2, 1.5, 2.5, 2.5)   ############################### #estimate values ############################### fit <- estimateIntervals(renewalRates = data,                         timeVars = "intStart",                         boneVars = c("bone1", "bone2", "tooth1", "tooth2"),                         isoMean = y_mean,                       isoSigma = y_sigma) print(fit) # implemented Methods plotTime(fit) #get estimates for specific time points estimateTimePoint(fit, time = seq(0,5, by = 0.5))  ############################### #shift point estimation ############################### plotTime(fit, plotShifts = TRUE, threshold = 0.5) plotTime(fit, plotShifts = TRUE, threshold = 0.5,          type = TRUE, probability = 0.5)  getShiftTime(fit, threshold = 0.5)   ############################### #Staying time estimation ###############################  estimatedStayTimes <- getSiteStayTimes(object = fit,                                       siteMeans = c(-8, -10),                                       siteSigma = c(1, 1.5))   ############################### #compute resulting isotopic values out of historic ones ###############################  testDat <- data.frame(  t = 1:3,  bone1 = c(100, 50, 10, 10, 10, 10),  bone2 = c(0, 20, 20, 20, 20, 20),  teeth1 = c(0, 0, 0, 10, 50, 60),  mean = c(1, 3, 3,0, -1, - 5),  sd = c(1, 3, 1, 1.5, 2, 3) )  computeResult(  data = testDat,  timeVars = "t",  boneVars = c("bone1","bone2","teeth1"),  meanVar = "mean",  sdVar = "sd" )  shiny::runApp(paste0(system.file(package = "OsteoBioR"),"/app")) }

title: Calculate time points of shifted isotopic values — getShiftTime
text: object model class TemporalIso type boolean calculation shall based absolute relative differences. Defaults TRUE slope boolean calculation shall based differences slopes Defaults FALSE (differences) threshold numeric. threshold shift considered "large". Defaults 1.5 absolute isotopic values 15 percent relative changes. probability probability differences larger threshold. Defaults 50 percent.
